alert.note: Alert for Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:36PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gloucester, Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, northwestern York, Mathews, northeastern New Kent, southeastern King William, northern James City and southeastern Lancaster Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 736 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barhamsville, or near Toano, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mathews, Gloucester Courthouse, West Point, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Norge, Deltaville, Toano, White Stone, Hayes, Saluda, Gwynn, Bavon, Hartfield, Glenns, Barhamsville, Blakes, Little Plymouth, Shacklefords and Mobjack. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent
